# Commit message style guide

Use conventional commit message format.

Here's a guide for emojis to use with conventional commit types:
ğŸ”§ config: Update configuration files
âœ¨ feat: New features
ğŸ› fix: Bug fixes
ğŸ“š docs: Documentation changes
ğŸ’ style: Code style changes (formatting, missing semi-colons, etc.)
ğŸ“¦ refactor: Code refactoring
ğŸš€ perf: Performance improvements
ğŸš¨ test: Adding or modifying tests
ğŸ› ï¸ build: Changes affecting the build system or external dependencies
âš™ï¸ ci: Changes to CI configuration files and scripts
â™»ï¸ chore: Other changes that don't modify src or test files
ğŸ—‘ï¸ revert: Reverting previous commits
Additional commit types and emojis:
ğŸ‰ initial: Initial commit
â« dependencies: Update dependencies
â¬†ï¸ peerDependencies: Update peer dependencies
ğŸ”¼ devDependencies: Update development dependencies
ğŸ“¦ metadata: Update metadata (package.json)
